author: Noticias SIN
title: Continuarán las lluvias durante el fin de semana; siguen provincias en alerta
text:
SANTO DOMINGO.- El Indomet informó que el territorio dominicano permanecerá bajo un ambiente húmedo e inestable, que el viento del noreste y la vaguada seguirán incidiendo sobre el país, debido a esto se prevén lluvias débiles a moderadas, siendo fuertes ocasionalmente con tronadas y ráfagas de viento desde la mañana, en especial hacia La Altagracia, El Seibo, Hato Mayor, Samaná, María Trinidad Sánchez, Duarte, Hermanas Mirabal, Espaillat, Puerto Plata, Santiago y La Vega.
Dijo que en la tarde, las lluvias continuarán con más frecuencia e intensidad en las provincias anteriormente mencionadas y se extenderán hacia La Romana, San Pedro de Macorís, El Gran Santo Domingo, Monte Plata, Elías Piña, San Juan, Pedernales, Barahona y Monte Cristi, hasta primeras horas de la noche. Durante horas nocturnas se pronostica la continuación de las lluvias hacia provincias cercanas al litoral atlántico.
Actualidad ciclónica:
Informamos de tres zonas de aguaceros, tormentas eléctricas y ráfagas de vientos con probabilidad de desarrollo ciclónico:
Debido a las lluvias caídas y las previstas en las próximas 24 a 72 horas, se mantienen los niveles de alerta y aviso meteorológicos, ante posibles inundaciones de ríos, arroyos y cañadas, así como, urbanas y rurales en las siguientes provincias:
NIVELES DE ALERTAS Y AVISOS METEOROLÓGICOS | |||
ALERTA | AVISO | DESCONTINUADAS | |
El Gran Santo Domingo | Puerto Plata | Hato Mayor | |
María Trinidad Sánchez | El Seibo | ||
Espaillat | Samaná | ||
Santiago | Hermanas Mirabal | Duarte | |
La Altagracia | |||
TOTAL: 2 | TOTAL: 9 | TOTAL: 0 |
En la costa Atlántica, se les recomienda a los operadores de frágiles, pequeñas y medianas embarcaciones, permanecer en puerto, debido a viento moderado con ocasionales ráfagas y olas de 7 a 9 pies cerca la costa, siendo superiores mar adentro. En las zonas costeras bajas de la costa norte, deben estar atentos por posibles inundaciones costeras.
En la costa Caribeña el oleaje se presenta normal.
Pronósticos del tiempo:
Distrito Nacional: nubes aisladas a dispersas, incrementándose ocasionalmente. En la tarde, aguaceros con posibles tronadas y ráfagas de viento.
Santo Domingo este: nubes aisladas a dispersas, incrementándose ocasionalmente. En la tarde, aguaceros con posibles tronadas y ráfagas de viento.
Santo Domingo Norte: nubes dispersas, incrementándose ocasionalmente. En la tarde, aguaceros con posibles tronadas y ráfagas de viento.
Santo Domingo Oeste: nubes aisladas a dispersas, incrementándose ocasionalmente. En la tarde, aguaceros con posibles tronadas y ráfagas de viento.
Temperatura mínima entre 20 °C y 22 °C y máxima entre 28 °C y 30 °C.

author: Agência Lusa
title: Supremo dos EUA inflige revés a luta contra poluição atmosférica – Observador
text:
O Supremo Tribunal dos Estados Unidos da América (EUA), de maioria conservadora, infligiu esta quinta-feira um revés à Agência de Proteção do Ambiente (EPA) ao suspender a aplicação de um plano de combate à poluição atmosférica.
Os juízes da mais alta instância judicial dos Estados Unidos decidiram, por cinco votos a favor e quatro contra, suspender a aplicação de um chamado plano de “boa vizinhança”, que pretende combater a poluição atmosférica que passa de um Estado para outro, enquanto não estiver resolvido um litígio num tribunal de apelação.
“A aplicação do plano da EPA aos queixosos deve ser suspensa até que os seus pedidos de revisão sejam decididos” por um tribunal de recurso em Washington, declarou o Supremo Tribunal no seu parecer.
A decisão foi tomada por uma maioria de cinco juízes conservadores contra os três progressistas , aos quais se juntou a juíza conservadora Amy Coney Barrett.
Segundo a EPA, o plano deve permitir reduzir o smog (poluição atmosférica), que é prejudicial à saúde, mas pode também ter “vantagens económicas”.
Mas a regulamentação foi contestada em tribunal por três estados governados por Republicanos — Ohio, Virgínia Ocidental e Indiana —, apoiados pelas indústrias metalúrgica e do carvão.
PUB • CONTINUE A LER A SEGUIR
De acordo com uma lei norte-americana sobre a poluição atmosférica, os estados federados são responsáveis por regulamentar a poluição pelo ozono a baixa altitude, mas a Agência de Proteção do Ambiente pode rejeitar ou obrigá-los a alterar os seus planos e definir normas comuns.
“A decisão de hoje é prejudicial não só para as comunidades que respiram ar poluído, mas para a própria democracia”, reagiu Holly Bender, do grupo de defesa ambiental Sierra Club, condenando o facto de o Supremo Tribunal “ter ficado do lado dos poluidores e da indústria”.
O Governo do Presidente Joe Biden tentou, nos últimos anos, repor legislação sobre a poluição atmosférica abolida pelo seu antecessor na Casa Branca, Donald Trump (2017-2021).

author: Mary Walrath-Holdridge
title: Kathleen Wilson's Minnesota dentist did 30 procedures at once: lawsuit
text: 20 fillings, 4 root canals, 8 crowns in one visit add up to lawsuit for Minnesota dentist [Mary Walrath-Holdridge](https://www.usatoday.com/staff/12093029002/mary-walrathholdridge/) A Minnesota dentist has become the subject of a malpractice lawsuit after his patient accused him of "disfiguring" her. The civil lawsuit was filed in Hennepin County, Minnesota last week by Kathleen Wilson, who alleged Dr. Kevin Molldrem and [Molldrem Family Dentistry](https://molldremdentistry.com/) caused her significant injury that is still being corrected. According to the suit, Molldrem performed more than 30 producers on Wilson in a single July 2020 visit, doing eight crowns, four root canals and 20 fillings in one go. The lawsuit alleges that the dentist "perform[ed] this work improperly," resulting in pain and suffering, embarrassment, emotional distress, and disfigurement. Molldrem was likewise accused of using improper levels of anesthesia during the procedures and falsifying medical records to cover it up. Treatment called 'inconceivable' “It is inconceivable that Dr. Molldrem could have prepared and placed 8 crowns under these circumstances in the time allotted, not to mention the additional 20 restorations,” wrote [Dr. Avrum Goldstein,](https://www.seakexperts.com/members/4827-avrum-r-goldstein) a dentist and expert witness brought on by Wilson's attorney, in an affidavit. Goldstein, who is a faculty member at [NOVA Southeastern University](https://dental.nova.edu/aboutus/faculty/goldstein-avrum%20.html?_gl=1*1kqtqxq*_gcl_au*ODA4NzUxNTA1LjE3MDM3OTc5MjI.), also wrote that Wilson had been correctly diagnosed as having a "rare condition" causing decay in almost all of her teeth, but Mollderm's course of action was not a proper form of treatment. "[Wilson’s] required a slow, thoughtful, careful and measured response to her disease,” he said in his report. “Trying to fill every hole in every tooth in her mouth in one visit is not only the antithesis of what was indicated, it is not humanly possible to achieve in an effective or constructive manner.” Doctors remove wrong organ from man: [They opened him up to remove his appendix. They mistakenly took out much more, lawsuit says.](/story/news/health/2023/11/07/doctors-accidentally-remove-wrong-organ-surgery/71487292007/) The lawsuit also accused Mollderm of tampering with medical records to falsify the amount of anesthesia that was reportedly used, which in reality was nearly double the standard number of units, according to court paperwork. According to Goldstein, the maximum dose of anesthesia given in three hours should not exceed 490 mg, but Molldrem's records show he gave Wilson 960 mg. “Any negative cardiovascular or central nervous system outcomes could be tied to the local anesthetic overdose," he wrote. Wilson said in the suit that she has since had to have the dental work completely redone by other dentists to repair Molldrem’s “negligent work," an ongoing process that has caused her to lose income and rack up medical bills on top of enduring pain, suffering and embarrassment. She is seeking more than $50,000 in damages. Wilson's attorney and Molldrem did not immediately respond to request for comment.

author: 小浪财讯
title: 医药龙头ETF（515950）跌0.79%，半日成交额978.62万元|ETF_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
6月19日，截止午间收盘，医药龙头ETF（515950）跌0.79%，报0.874元，成交额978.62万元。医药龙头ETF（515950）重仓股方面， 药明康德 截止午盘跌1.02%， 恒瑞医药 跌0.66%， 迈瑞医疗 跌1.30%， 爱尔眼科 跌1.16%， 片仔癀 跌0.12%， 联影医疗 涨0.26%， 科伦药业 跌1.28%， 长春高新 跌2.06%， 康龙化成 跌1.97%， 东阿阿胶 跌0.32%。
医药龙头ETF（515950）业绩比较基准为中证医药50指数收益率，管理人为富国基金管理有限公司，基金经理为王乐乐，成立（2020-03-16）以来回报为-1.11%，近一个月回报为0.91%。

author: Doc Louallen
title: Washington man bear sprays carjackers to protect his mother: Police
text: A Washington man used bear spray to fend off two attackers who attempted to carjack his elderly mother on Tuesday, bringing an end to a crime spree that included multiple carjackings and police chases, authorities said. "One of the suspects tried taking the elderly lady out of the driver seat but the woman made it hard for him to close the door," said Washington State Patrol Trooper Rick Johnson. "Her son, who was parked next to her, came around and sprayed bear mace." The woman's son told KOMO News he tried to stop a suspect by spraying him in the face with bear spray, but it didn't initially seem to phase the man. After it didn't work, the suspect got inside the victim's car but was unable to drive away because the victim had the keys in his pocket, according to investigators. "His face was all red and he was crying," the man told KOMO News. "His girlfriend asked me what I sprayed with and I sprayed her in the face, too." The two suspects, believed to be a man and a woman in their 30s, were arrested as Federal Way police arrived at the scene, KOMO News reported. The suspects face charges of eluding police, carjacking, and hit and run, according Johnson. According to the investigators, two suspects were eluding Kent police in a stolen vehicle driving northbound on Interstate 5. After a short time chasing after the stolen car, Kent police stopped their pursuit due to strict laws in Washington about officers in high-speed chases. Kent police officers reported the suspects hit multiple cars as they were escaping. The suspects lost control of their vehicle and stopped at a rest area off I-5 in Federal Way, nearly 8 miles north of their first encounter with Kent police. The suspects tried to break into three cars while at the rest stop, state investigators said. One of the suspects opened 72-year-old woman's car door, leading to the bear spray encounter. Investigators said none of the victims suffered serious injuries as the suspects tried stealing the cars. "I never thought something like this would happen to me, you see stuff all the time," the woman's son told KOMO News, "He's lucky I had bear spray otherwise I would have knocked him to the ground."

author: Olalekan Adigun
title: The Rise of Plant-Based Milk: A Green Alternative to Dairy
text:
In an era where sustainability is not just a choice but a necessity, the shift from traditional dairy milk to plant-based alternatives is more than a dietary trend—it's a critical move towards protecting our planet. With the dairy industry's environmental toll coming to light, consumers are increasingly opting for greener substitutes. A pivotal 2018 study unveiled the stark contrast in environmental impact between dairy and plant-based milks, positioning soy, oat, and almond milks not just as alternatives, but as beacons of eco-conscious consumption.
The Environmental Case for Plant-Based Milk
The numbers speak volumes: dairy milk emits approximately three times more greenhouse gases than any plant-based counterpart. The requirement of nine times more land and an exorbitant amount of water for cow's milk production underscores a pressing need for change. While goat and sheep milk might seem like viable alternatives, their environmental footprints are similarly concerning. Among the plant-based options, soy milk emerges as the champion of eco-friendliness, boasting the lowest carbon footprint. Conversely, almond milk, despite its minimal land requirements, demands significant water resources. However, the rise of oat milk, alongside other newcomers like pea and hemp milk, offers promising solutions with low land use, water consumption, and greenhouse emissions.
Responding to Demand: Danone's Strategic Shift
In a bold stride towards sustainability, Danone has revamped a plant in France to exclusively produce Alpro-branded oat-based beverages. This move reflects the surging demand for plant-based foods across Europe, a trend that has propelled the sales value of plant-based milk to €2.21 billion in 2022. With Alpro leading the charge, Danone's pivot underscores the industry's acknowledgment of plant-based milk not just as an alternative, but as the future of dairy. The environmental benefits of oat, soy, and almond milks are integral to this transition, highlighting the sector's potential in mitigating climate change.
Choosing Our Future: The Spectrum of Plant-Based Milks
While the environmental superiority of plant-based milks is clear, the landscape is diverse. Soy and oat milks lead the way in sustainability, offering an optimal balance of low land and water usage with minimal greenhouse gas emissions. Almond milk, despite its heavier water footprint, remains a popular choice for its minimal land use. On the horizon are innovative options like rice, pea, and hemp milks, each with unique benefits and challenges. Yet, regardless of these differences, the shift towards plant-based alternatives is a collective stride towards a more sustainable and environmentally conscious global diet.
In conclusion, the dairy industry's environmental impact, with its heavy land, water, and greenhouse gas demands, presents a compelling case for the shift to plant-based milks. As consumers increasingly lean towards eco-friendly options, the growth of the plant-based milk sector, spearheaded by companies like Danone, signals a significant change in consumption patterns. With options ranging from soy to oat milk leading the charge, the movement towards plant-based alternatives not only reflects a growing environmental awareness but also offers a beacon of hope for a more sustainable future.

author: Vinson Kurian
title: Heavy rain lashes parts of Tamil Nadu, Rayalaseema, Kerala as South Peninsula braces for more rain   - The Hindu BusinessLine
text:
Heavy to very heavy rain lashed isolated places over Tamil Nadu , Puducherry & Karaikal on Thursday while it was heavy over Rayalaseema under the influence of a well-marked low-pressure area, which has weakened the morning after on Friday.
Moderate to heavy rain Significant rain (in cm):recorded until 5.30 pm on Thursday over the meteorological subdivisions of Tamil Nadu, Karaikal & Puducherry; Rayalaseema; and Kerala & Lakshadweep is as follows:
Tiruttani, Atiramapattinam and Chennai-8 each; Tirupathi-7; Nungambakkam and Karaikal-4 each; Yercaud-3; Nagapattinam, K. Paramathy and Tiruppattur-2 each; Dharmapuri, Kodaikanal, Madurai, Tiruchirappalli, Salem, Cuddalore, Parangipettai and Coimbatore -1 each; Arogyaram-1; Punalur, Thiruvananthapuram and Bengaluru-1 each.
Also read: Snowfall ends long dry spell in Kashmir, brings joy to farmers, tourists System to weaken further India Meteorological Department (IMD) said this (Friday) morning that prevailing low-pressure area over Gulf of Mannar and adjoining Comorin area will move westwards towards Maldives and adjoining Lakshadweep area across Comorin area and weaken further gradually till Saturday.
As predicted earlier, the movement away of this system will be followed close on the heels by a fresh rain wave across the Bay of Bengal and likely aimed at the south Tamil Nadu and Sri Lanka coast over next few days. The IMD has maintained a watch for a fresh spell of rain over Tamil Nadu, Puducherry and Karaial; Kerala & Mahe; coastal Andhra Pradesh; south interior Karnataka; Lakshadweep; and Andaman & Nicobar Islands as follows.
Also read: Once ‘poor man’s cooking oil’, palm oil is now pricier than soyabean, sunflower oils Fresh incoming rain wave Tamil Nadu, Puducherry & Karaikal : Heavy to very heavy rain at isolated places on Tuesday. Isolated heavy rain likely today (Friday) and early next week on Monday and Tuesday.
Kerala & Mahe : Heavy to very heavy rain at isolated places on 1Friday. Isolated heavy rain on Tuesday and Wednesday.
Coastal Andhra Pradesh and Rayalaseema: Heavy rain at isolated places on Tuesday and Wednesday.
South Interior Karnataka : Heavy rain at isolated places likely on Tuesday.
Lakshadweep : Heavy rain at isolated places today (Friday).
Andaman & Nicobar Islands : Heavy rain at isolated places for three days from Friday.
Towards the north, a western disturbance is seen as a cyclonic circulation over north Pakistan on Friday morning with an accompanying trough cutting across Bathinda, Patiala, Saharanpur and Pauri across the meteorological subdivisions of Punjab, West Uttar Pradesh and Uttarakhand and influencing winter weather over north and North-West India.

author: Shub Banerjee
title: Ex-EFL Star Says Player Could Become 'Absolute Hero' For Birmingham City
text: Ex-Championship star Sam Parkin is of the view that Birmingham City new boy Jay Stansfield has the opportunity to become the hero of the club by taking them to the Premier League. Stansfield played last season on loan at Birmingham City and the club hierarchy made it their goal to sign him on a permanent transfer this summer. Blues stunned the division by agreeing to a League One record deal with Fulham, where they paid a fee in the north of £10m to secure the signature of the centre forward. Parkin believes that Stansfield has an opportunity to recreate what Paul Mullin did for Wrexham by leading them to multiple promotions. He stressed that Stansfield will become Premier League material soon and pointed out that the youngster could become a hero at St. Andrew’s by helping them to the top tier of English football. “Look what Paul Mullin did, for example, when there was a project that clearly has the aspirations and financial backing to go through the divisions”, Parkin [said on What The EFL](https://podfollow.com/1642461171/episode/13180fcec8a4670f814faffc95a21b6d55420fef). “He has been there; they love him and you have to put all that into the equation and there is an opportunity for him in the next two or three years to get into the Premier League with Birmingham City, where he would be an absolute hero and he is going to have a nice payback as well. “I get it all, but it is just probably that it is still a gamble even though he will be nearly ready to be contributing in the Premier League.” Birmingham City are set to face Wrexham after the international break and all eyes will be on whether Stansfield’s name will be in Chris Davies’ starting line-up for the game.
